speakers.bioFull: I live in Berkeley, CA with my wife, two cats, and a whole lot of computers. I was weaned as a software developer on various implementations of Microsoft's BASIC in the 80's, starting with my first microcomputer, the Texas Instruments TI-99/4a. I continued on the PC with Visual Basic 3.0 and Windows 3.1 in the early 90's, although I also spent significant time writing Pascal code in the first versions of Delphi. I am now quite comfortable in VB.NET or C#, despite the evils of case sensitivity. I consider myself a reasonably experienced Windows software developer with a particular interest in the human side of software development, as represented in my recommended developer reading list. Computers are fascinating machines, but they're mostly a reflection of the people using them. In the art of software development, studying code isn't enough: you have to study the people behind the software, too.

speakers.bioFull: I have been in the software industry for 20+ years. In the past 4 years I have worked on cloud based distributed systems for Netflix and Stubhub. Most of these systems have been associated with data delivery and management. Some of the systems I have with with are: Solr, Cassandra, Zookeeper, Hadoop and StubHubs Big Data Platform. All these systems require a different approach in design,development and access patterns.  However, there are underlying patterns in each of these systems. And these patterns radically change the approach of developers and users of these systems. Without them, building and deploying distributed systems, especially at scale, becomes exceedingly problematic. I wish to share some of these design and deployment patterns as well as their  programming models with the folks at SVCC.
speakers.bio: I consider myself a pragmatic architect with many years of experience in designing and building software systems. From embedded code to distributed systems every software product poses interesting challenges and solutions. I consider myself a pragmatic software architect – someone who finds that adaptive design appears in the friction between ideas and implementation, vision and application, abstraction and ground reality. Or - as the Chinese say: between the thunder and the rain.
speakers.name: John Brinnand

Jon has done formal training or presentations on C++ at ACCU-Silicon Valley, Altara, Apple, Amazon, Bloomberg, BMW, C++Now, CppCon, HTRI, Microsoft, New York C++ Developers' Group, Portland C++ Users Group, San Francisco C++ User Group, Silicon Valley Code Camp, and Societe Generale.

Nowadays he writes web & mobile apps for a Southern California-based automotive valuation and information company. He has hung up is assembly language hat, but is fluent in JavaScript, C#, C++, Java, Kotlin, and Clojure.

Nights and weekends he can usually be found writing cool apps for mobile and the web or teaching other developers how to do so. speakers.bioFull: Yann Yu is a Systems Engineer at LucidWorks and brings years of experience in search, natural language processing and internationalization to the Lucidworks team. As part of the professional Services group at Lucidworks, Yann has architected and deployed Solr solutions for hundreds of customers, including those in the Fortune 500. He has collaborated with Lucidworks Hadoop partners to integrate large-scale, high volume Hadoop deployments with Solr all over the world. Previously a software developer at Basis Technology, Yann worked extensively on Rosette Entity Extractor and Rosette Language Identifier products.

speakers.bioFull:
Bob Zeidman is the president and founder of Zeidman Technologies where he invented the patented SynthOS™ program for automatically generating real-time software. He is considered a pioneer in the fields of analyzing and synthesizing software source code. 
Bob is a prolific writer and instructor, giving seminars at conferences around the world. Among his publications are numerous articles on engineering and business as well as five textbooks, Designing with FPGAs and CPLDs, Verilog Designer's Library, Introduction to Verilog, The Software IP Detective’s Handbook, and Just Enough Electronics to Impress Your Friends and Colleagues. He is also author of the award-winning novels The Amazing Adventure of Edward and Dr. Sprechtmachen, Horror Flick, and Good Intentions as well as the award-winning but as-yet unproduced screenplays Sex and Violence, The Amazing Adventure of Edward and Dr. Sprechtmachen, and Horror Flick.
Bob is the recipient of the 2010 Outstanding Engineer in a Specialized Field from the IEEE Santa Clara Valley Section for Innovative Contributions in the Area of Forensic Software Analysis. He holds numerous patents and earned two bachelor's degrees, in physics and electrical engineering, from Cornell University and a master's degree in electrical engineering from Stanford University.

sessions.title: Developing applications with a micro-service architecture
sessions.description: In this talk we describe the micro-service architecture and how to use it to build complex applications.

sessions.title: Map, flatmap and reduce are your new best friends

sessions.title: How Do Teams Reach High Performance?
sessions.description: This year Greg Geracie and Ron Lichty will present key findings from the 2014 global study of product team performance. Join us! Learn how you can improve your product team's performance!

sessions.title: Build a cross-platform enterprise LOB mobile app with offline sync
sessions.description: Learn how to build enterprise LOB iOS, Android, and Windows Apps which use offline sync for intermittent connectivity.

sessions.title: Exception-Safe Coding in C++: Part I
sessions.description:
Are you 100% confident that your code is exception-safe?

Safe exception usage is a problem that we've struggled with for decades.

You'll know how to create code that is easier to read and write, faster, and 100% robust in the face of exceptions.

sessions.description:

sessions.description: Learn what developers need to know about networking (The TCP/IP kind, not the Facebook kind).

sessions.description: This session will go over the top 10 things a developer needs to know to use AngularJS effectively, and have more fun programming.

sessions.description: Learn how to avoid licensing pitfalls from an experienced programmer-turned-lawyer.

sessions.title: Synthesizing an Optimized Application Specific OS for your IoT Device
sessions.description: Software synthesis can automatically create a fast, small, secure operating system based on the application requirements that is ideal for the IoT.

sessions.title: Introduction to Natural Language Processing (NLP)
sessions.description: Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Understanding (NLU) aim to make machines process human languages like English.  This session will provide a complete overview of the field from the basic structure of human languages to the state of the art.

sessions.title: Swift language and using Playgrounds
sessions.description: A detailed tutorial of the Swift programming language and in depth tour of the new Playgrounds.

sessions.title: Whirlwind Tour of Scalable Vector Graphics
sessions.description: In this session, we’ll walk through the essential building blocks of SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics). We’ll learn how to script against SVG with JavaScript libraries like Raphaël and D3 to make interactive web applications.

sessions.title: Introductory Minecraft Modding with Forge - Part 1
sessions.description: In this session, you will learn the basics of making Minecraft mods using Forge. We will setup a basic development environment and create a few mods.

sessions.title: Lego Mindstorms Programming 4 Kids
sessions.description: In this session we will be using the Java programming language to write simple algorithms that power windmills, drive cars, and draw pictures using Lego Mindstorms EV3.

sessions.title: Programming a Graphical Web Game, Part 1
sessions.description: Learn to program a graphical game that runs in a Web browser using JavaScript, the Phaser (http://phaser.io) gaming library, HTML and CSS.

sessions.title: Programming a Graphical Web Game, Part 2
sessions.description: Learn to program a graphical game that runs in a Web browser using JavaScript, the Phaser (http://phaser.io) gaming library, HTML and CSS.

sessions.title: Azure Virtual Machines (IaaS in the Microsoft cloud)
sessions.description: Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines is the IaaS offering in the Azure Platform. In this session, Neil will provide an in-depth review of Azure Virtual Machines and describe some best practices in deploying applications into Azure Virtual Machines.

sessions.title: An Introduction to using Apache Spark for Machine Learning
sessions.description: Apache Spark is a fast distributed processing engine written in Scala and running atop Hadoop. This talk will describe the Spark MLLib library and then dive in to coding examples in Classification, Clustering, and Feature Selection

sessions.title: Maximize your Cache for no Cash
sessions.description: There are six levels of cache between your code and the users browser experience. You can take advantage of them all to provide a quicker, slicker, better user experience for the user and it won't cost you a dime to do it.

sessions.title: Introductory Minecraft Modding with Forge - Part II
sessions.description: In this session, you will learn the basics of making Minecraft mods using Forge. We will setup a basic development environment and create a few plugins.

sessions.title: Solving performance problems on Java web applications - Our experiences
sessions.description: Tune Java web applications. identify and solve performance issues.

sessions.title: Functional Programming for Production Quality Code
sessions.description: Practical functional techniques for correct production quality code using the strongly-typed functional-first language F#. Applicable across Linux and Windows servers, all mobile devices, and single board computers such as Raspberry Pi.

sessions.title: Lean Startup for Engineers
sessions.description: Learn how to identify your customer and understand their problem. Only then can you be sure you're solving the right problem for the right person. Critical for anyone building software or developing products. Your mind WILL BE BLOWN!

sessions.title: Manipulating Properties in Scala. Why Flat Properties are Best.
sessions.description:
During the last 2 years I've been developing a container for properties in Scala. Other solutions exist, but this one is pretty sophisticated. 
I'll also demonstrate why properties should be flat in memory.

sessions.title: Exploring the Brain-Computer Interface
sessions.description: The Brain-Computer Interface is a mainstay of science-fiction. Come learn the science fact with an actual demonstrations of a Brain-Computer Interface in action as a volunteer flies a Quadricopter using only their mind.

sessions.description: Most people think of F# as good at math or complex problem solving. It is actually a fantastic for a very wide array of tasks, including web programming, which helped the start-up Tachyus go from 0 to production in 12 weeks.

sessions.title: Why Would You Integrate Solr and Hadoop? (and why would you do that?)
sessions.description: A discussion of how Solr and Hadoop complement each other, and how to use Solr as a real-time, analytical, full-text search front-end to data stored in Hadoop.

sessions.title: PowerShell and DevOps
sessions.description: Learn to use PowerShell to troubleshoot and monitor application

sessions.title: Managing the Unmanageable 1-Day Workshop
sessions.description: A 1 day workshop that will give you the tools, insights, and confidence to manage programmers and programming teams effectively.

sessions.title: First steps with MongoDB
sessions.description: MongoDB is a very popular NoSQL database that is fast and scalable. This talk will arm you with the essential skills to start using Mongo. Leave your tabular thinking behind and come see how things can be very different with MongoDB.

sessions.title: Azure for Open Source Developers
sessions.description: Learn how to use Node, Python, and other OSS technologies on Azure, Microsoft's cloud platform.

sessions.title: Accidentally Manager – A Survival Guide for First-Time Engineering Managers
sessions.description: This session is about your career perspective as an engineer, especially when the path may take an “unexpected” turn from technical lead to first-time engineering manager.

sessions.title: Clean Code I - Best Practices
sessions.description: Writing clean code already makes you more efficient during the initial development time & results in more stable code. We will review best practices which will make you write better and more easily maintainable code, seeing code in a holistic way.

sessions.description: We will dive into the basics of Inversion of Control (IOC) and Dependency Injection (DI) to review different ways of achieving decoupling, using and exploring both: Best Practices, Design and Anti Patterns.

sessions.title: Understanding HTTP and REST: the road to simple, scalable web services
sessions.description: HTTP is the protocol for virtually all things on the internet.  Do you have the info you need to build apps and services that can participate? You will leave this session with an understanding of the HTTP protocol and how it can be combed with REST.

sessions.title: The REST of the story: Using ASP.NET Web API to create RESTful web services
sessions.description: REST is are a simple way to expose data to a broad range of platforms.  ASP.NET Web API is a great foundation for REST services, but its not an out-of-the-box solution.   This talk introduces you ASP.NET Web API and building REST services using it

sessions.title: Distributed Systems - Patterns and Practices
sessions.description: Patterns and practices for developing and deploying distributed systems.

sessions.description: No person survives as an island, and no career grows spontaneously. In this session, we will discuss how to strategically grow your professional opportunities by participating in technical communities.

sessions.description: Freya brings the web machine approach to .NET. Learn some of the challenges in building web apps and show how the machine approach can help you focus more on building your applications and less on getting the HTTP parts right.

sessions.title: Managing Programmers
sessions.description: Programmers are not like the other kids. They cannot and should not be managed like normal people.

sessions.description:
Want Jedi like leadership? 
Come grasp why Agile teams communicate 5x+ more effectively and the underlying principles you can use to 
Create Influence, On Demand

sessions.description: Tricks and tips for getting maximum performance in C#.

sessions.description: This talk suggests a way forward, taking inspiration from our successful transition from NTSC to HDTV. There is a way forward to a web that is safer, easier, and as good as we desire.

sessions.description: I will talk about these security standards, and go over the use cases from an API Provider as well as Consumer's standpoint. We will also cover how they work in the real world, if time permits.

sessions.description: Learn how to develop event-driven micro services with event sourcing and Command Query Responsibility Segregation

sessions.title: Deploying Applications using the Docker ecosystem
sessions.description: Find out how you can use Docker and the Docker ecosystem to test, build, and deploy your Java and JavaScript-based components of your application.

sessions.description: This workshop is a beginner level class that will take you step by step through the process of building an Angular 1.x application. You'll learn how to combine your previous HTML and Javascript knowledge with AngularJS also

sessions.description: We will look at all of these things and more from a variety of angles, while also covering many of the tips, tricks, tools, etc. I have collected in my almost 45,000 man hours of working with SQL Server.

sessions.description: We engineers build features without ever talking to the customers and users who they benefit. We'll start with how to define your customer and discover what their true problem is.

sessions.description: Women engineers often think they are not innovative. In this interactive workshop attendees will have the opportunity to start the innovation process using mind maps, user design thinking and moving their ideas through the corporate maze.

sessions.description: Demonstrate how the open source TestScribe tool can make developers' life much easier by letting developers focus on choosing inputs and interpreting outputs, taking repetitive work out of the testing process.

sessions.description: In this session I will walk you through how to build your own retro handheld console that is powered by Java, runs on a Raspberry Pi, and is printed on a 3D printer.

sessions.description: You ever wonder how to start a JUG, become a Java Champion, or get published in Java Magazine?  In this presentation you will learn all of the insider secrets on how to become a presence in the worldwide community of 9 million Java developers.

sessions.title: Building IOS9 Apps Using Swift 2.0 And Xcode 7 Beta
sessions.description: This session will show how easy it is to build a demo app using the latest Beta iOS tool chain.

sessions.description:
Containers are enabling developers to package their
applications (and underlying dependencies) in new ways that are
portable and work consistently everywhere? 
On your machine, in
production, in your data center, and in the cloud. And Docker has
become the de facto standard for those portable containers in the
cloud.

sessions.title: First steps with MongoDB
sessions.description: Mongo is a fast, scalable, and extremely popular database. Come learn what it is, what it ain't, and how to use it!

sessions.description: Learn how to build cross-platform iOS and Android apps with native performance using Xamarin.

In the process, you'll also learn some basic Java programming skills. The workshop will use Eclipse for editing and so kids will get their first experience of IDE as well.

sessions.title: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
sessions.description: Building blocks of Microsoft Azure and see how they work together

sessions.title: Where did I put my (primary) keys?
sessions.description: Ever wondered why so many tables have ID fields used as primary keys? If you have not - this session is for you...

sessions.description: Create Tweet Monkey using a smattering of basic electronics, a dash of Node.js, and the inevitable subsequent merriment of Tweet Monkey! Batteries included. A complete Tweet Monkey kit including a Raspberry Pi 2 will be given away.

sessions.title: Unit Testing SQL Server
sessions.description: Join me to quickly learn about why database-level testing is critically important and also why it has heretofore been nearly impossible to do well. Then we will discover a free new framework that makes it quite approachable!

sessions.title: RESTful Microservices
sessions.description: This session covers the microservice architectural style, and the RESTful manner in which microservices are usually exposed. We'll cover the theory behind REST before diving into pragmatic implementation styles and better practices.

sessions.title: Accidentally Manager – A Survival Guide for First-Time Engineering Managers
sessions.description: This session is about your career perspective as an engineer, especially when the path may take an “unexpected” turn from technical lead to first-time engineering manager.

sessions.title: Clean Code I - Best Practices
sessions.description: Writing clean code can significantly lower these costs. You will be presented design patterns and best practices which will make you write better and more easily maintainable code, seeing code in a holistic way.

sessions.title: Clean Code II - Dependency Injection
sessions.description: We will dive into the basics of Inversion of Control (IOC) and Dependency Injection (DI) to review different ways of achieving decoupling, using and exploring both: Best Practices, Design and Anti Patterns.

sessions.title: Crafting an Effective Agile Development Culture
sessions.description: What differentiates successful agile culture? Successful cultures are not just performant but delight customers and are a joy for every team member. In agile cultures, it’s not just managers who are responsible for crafting culture - but everyone.

sessions.title: Mastering Node.js Modules
sessions.description: One of the most significant values of Node.js is the community of packages written for it. Come learn how to grasp how node package management works and how to work with it.

sessions.title: 0 to 60 with Regular Expressions in 75 minutes
sessions.description: Regular expressions are used for manipulating and analyzing text. We will be discussing them as a language and cover the syntax with extensive demos covering writing, testing, performance optimization, readability, compilation, and design guidelines.

sessions.title: Identify & Solve Performance problems
sessions.description: Identifying memory leaks and continuous profiling of running applications in production environments will also be discussed

sessions.title: Fast-Track Your Development Environment Setup and Management with Vagrant
sessions.description: Come learn how Vagrant will make it easier to manage your development environment setup and remove the "works on my machine" excuse for your team.

sessions.title: Distributed Data - System Design
sessions.description: How to design and build bigger better distributed data systems.

sessions.title: Run MongoDB Like a Champ!
sessions.description: MongoDB is an open-source, document-oriented, NoSQL database that is fast becoming to go-to choice for many organizations. Although cunningly easy to set up and get started, MongoDB is a database, and therefore requires proper care and knowledge to run successfully in a large scale production environment.

sessions.title: MIT App Inventor, android Mobile Application
sessions.description:
In this session kids will create app where they can upload a picture and paint and write on it with different brush colors like red,green, blue or any of their choice.
If time persist we can also make small game called Mole Mash.

sessions.title: Bringing Web Content to the Big Screen with Google Cast
sessions.description: In this talk, Google Lead Technical Solutions Engineer Kevin Nilson will talk about Chrome Sender App Development and HTML5/JavaScript Receiver Development.

sessions.title: The Agile Manifesto in the Star Wars Universe
sessions.description: What better way to study the Agile Manifesto, than in the fun and easily understandable context of Star Wars?!

sessions.description: The talk will cover the wearables as the integration of fashion industry and the advanced technologies. We will analyse the different forms of the collaborations and radically new products, that combine the best that two industries can offer.

sessions.title: Creating Micro-services in Microsoft Service Fabric
sessions.description: This session shows how to create, deploy and orchestrate services in Microsoft Service Fabric, a public-preview supporting the creation of stateless and stateful micro-services in Windows, scaling from a single machine to hyperscale in Azure.

In the process, you'll also learn some basic Java programming skills. The workshop will use Eclipse for editing and so kids will get their first experience of IDE as well.

sessions.title: Raspberry Pi Gaming 4 Kids
sessions.description: Students will get a chance to assemble a mini computer from scratch, learn to use the command line to compile and execute programs, and to make small enhancements to an existing program.

sessions.title: Lego Mindstorms Programming 4 Kids (Part 1 of 2)
sessions.description: Students will get a chance to build projects from scratch with Lego bricks, deploy and run Java on the Mindstorms Intelligent Brick, and edit Java code on their laptops to make improvements to the projects.

sessions.title: Lego Mindstorms Programming 4 Kids (Part 2 of 2)
sessions.description: Students will get a chance to build projects from scratch with Lego bricks, deploy and run Java on the Mindstorms Intelligent Brick, and edit Java code on their laptops to make improvements to the projects.

sessions.title: Real Communication with Real People in Real Time with WebRTC. For Reals.
sessions.description: In this code-driven talk, I’ll introduce you to WebRTC and how you can use it to build communication directly in a web browser. We’ll explore the JavaScript API’s and network communication concepts needed to make these applications work.

sessions.title: Introduction to Ember 2.0
sessions.description: Ember.js is a framework well-suited for complex and highly interactive apps. Its “convention over configuration” philosophy can end up saving developers from spending time and energy, having to write boilerplate code.

sessions.title: First steps with MongoDB (Repeat)
sessions.description: Mongo is a fast, scalable, and extremely popular database. Come learn what it is, what it ain't, and how to use it!

sessions.title: Deploying Applications using the Docker ecosystem (Repeat)
sessions.description: Find out how you can use Docker and the Docker ecosystem to test, build, and deploy your Java and JavaScript-based components of your application.

sessions.title: Keys to Exceptional Product Team Performance
sessions.description: Have you experienced the thrill of being on a truly high-performing team? It’s too rare. Insights from thousands on product teams who participated in the Study of Product Team Performance. Take aways: where you can focus to take your team to awesome.

sessions.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
sessions.description: What's the deal with the coding interviews at companies like Google and Facebook? Learn what these companies really want, what CS topics you do and don't need to know, and strategies to solve their tough coding and algorithm problems.

sessions.title: Be a Better Interviewer: How to Interview Like Google (or not)-But Better!
sessions.description: Be a better interviewer: make candidates happier, raise the bar, create a consistent process, and avoid rejecting good candidates or hiring bad ones. We'll discuss multiple interview styles so you can interview like Google (or not)-but better!

sessions.title: The Seif Project Continued
sessions.description: This talk introduces Seif, an open source project that  has the goal of transitioning the web into an application delivery system that will be safer, easier to use, and easier to develop for.

sessions.title: Apple & Google Native Mobile Development
sessions.description: We will creating a simple native app in both Apple Swift/iOS Xcode and Google Java/Android Studio.  Then we will compare and contracts the development environment and App Stores.

sessions.title: Predicting the Future with Machine Learning
sessions.description: This session will teach you how Machine Learning models that can predict the future are created.

sessions.title: Create Influence, On Demand
sessions.description: Want Jedi like leadership? Come grasp why Agile teams communicate 5x+ more effectively and the underlying principles you can use to...Create Influence, On Demand

sessions.title: SQL Server Partitioning Basics: Treating Your Tables Like Legos
sessions.description: With partitioning, you can break a table down into smaller chunks. We’ll go over basic partitioning concepts and techniques and at the end you’ll have a firm understanding of how partitioning works.

sessions.title: Internationalization at Startups
sessions.description: When startups start looking at additional revenue and growth opportunities, some look into expanding into international markets. There is an art of pivoting successfully into a global player, we will review the best practices in the industry.

sessions.title: The nits and grits of Git - How Git really works
sessions.description: In this presentation we deep dive into the hidden internals of the Git distributed version control system to find out how they really work.

sessions.title: MongoDB First Steps
sessions.description: MongoDB is an extremely popular document oriented database that is fast and scalable. This session will get you familiar with this unique database and arm you with the essential skills to start using Mongo to power your software applications.

sessions.title: Concurrency is child's play! (Powerful, Naïve,  and full of "Oops!")
sessions.description: Humans are notoriously bad multi-taskers. Computers, it turns out, are not much better... When implementing concurrency, some concepts that are easy to get wrong. These issues creep up anywhere from multi-threading to large distributed systems.

sessions.title: Building Serverless Microservices
sessions.description: In this talk we’ll explore how two revolutionary ideas come together: Microservice architectures that help you organize your backend into individually deployable units, and implementing those services in a functional way using AWS Lambda.

sessions.title: Modularizing Features for Rapid Independent Deployment
sessions.description: This talk focuses on modularizing features for large scale web applications. The intent is to write applications in such a way that you can easily develop and deploy to production. Yahoo Mail, currently using this architecture, has daily deployments.

sessions.title: Developing a Design Sense for your Code
sessions.description:
We are going to use some cutting edge training to train your pattern recognition section of your brain to instantly recognize common reoccurring anti-pattern in your code. 
After you see them, we will learn to fix them.

sessions.title: MongoDB Crash Course
sessions.description: MongoDB is the to go-to database for many organizations. While it is easy to set up, it is a serious database, requiring care and knowledge to run successfully in production. This workshop will show you how to set up and use MongoDB like a champ!

sessions.title: Package, Deploy, Scale Your Applications Using Docker and Kubernetes
sessions.description: This tutorial shows how to package, deploy, and scale Java applications with Docker and Kubernetes.

sessions.title: Managing Software People and Teams
sessions.description: A 1 day workshop that will give you the tools, insights, and confidence to manage programmers and programming teams effectively. Learn how to turbocharge your career and deliver outstanding results for your company!

sessions.title: Accidentally Manager – A Survival Guide for First-Time Engineering Managers
sessions.description: This session is about your career perspective as an engineer, especially when the path may take an “unexpected” turn from technical lead to first-time engineering manager.

sessions.title: Clean Code I - Best Practices
sessions.description: Writing clean code can significantly lower these costs. However, writing clean code also makes you more efficient during the initial development time and results in more stable code, seeing the code in a holistic way.

sessions.title: Clean Code II - Dependency Injection
sessions.description: We will dive into the basics of Inversion of Control (IOC) and Dependency Injection (DI) to review different ways of achieving decoupling, using and exploring both: Best Practices, Design and Anti-Patterns.

sessions.title: Developing Microservices with Aggregates
sessions.description: Learn how to Domain-Driven design aggregates to design modular business logic that can be partitioned into microservices.

sessions.title: Productive TypeScript and React with WebStorm
sessions.description: Angular 2’s summer rollout is generating tremendous interest, with a major emphasis on tooling via  TypeScript. In this session, we look at how an advanced IDE like WebStorm can put this tooling to work.

sessions.title: Functional Programming in JavaScript
sessions.description: Unlike most other programming languages, JavaScript straddles the line between imperative, object-oriented languages and functional ones. What if we programmed JavaScript functionally?

sessions.title: TCP/IP Networking for Developers
sessions.description: Learn what developers need to know about networking (The TCP/IP kind, not the Facebook kind).

sessions.title: Go for Java Developers
sessions.description: For Java programmers, Go seems familiar in some ways, but very different in others. This session I'll go over the technical and philosophical differences and similarities. I'll assume you're a pretty fluent Java developer.

sessions.title: Advanced PowerShell in the Real World
sessions.description: Everyone loves the PowerShell one liner. But how do you manage 31,407 one liners?

sessions.title: A math-free introduction to Neural Networks
sessions.description: Have you ever wanted to learn about the tech that powers Google but are allergic to dense equations?  This is the talk for you!  Learn how to build your own neural network with nothing more than addition & multiplication.

sessions.title: Extreme ‘Fake It Till You Make It’
sessions.description:
1 Red - 1 Green - 40 Refactors
Refactoring is the step that let’s us tease apart the logic of our code. ‘Fake it till you make it’ allows for us to evolve an emergent solution to complex problems. this is usually glossed but not in this session

sessions.title: Entry Point Node
sessions.description:
A total noobs guide to Node.js.
Node.js is taking the world by storm and developers can no longer afford to avoid it. Nor should you want to! Writing JavaScript went from ugh to awesome thanks to things like ES6 and TypeScript.

sessions.title: I Want to be a Maker Too!
sessions.description:
Practical guide to becoming a Modern Maker
I'm headlong into it, but I still remember the day I was bewildered by the terms and wondering how to get started. That’s what id like to do for you – introduce you to the Makers’ world!

sessions.title: Azure from the Command Line
sessions.description:
Managing your cloud without taking your hands off the keyboard
Web portals for managing your enterprise (or hobby) cloud services is cute, but when it's time to get real work done, there's nothing like a command line.

sessions.title: Technology and Fashion awaken the Soul of the Shoe
sessions.description: The talk will cover the wearables as the integration of fashion industry and the advanced technologies. We will analyze the different forms of the collaborations and radically new products, that combine the best that two industries can offer.

sessions.title: Defeat the Zombies with Java
sessions.description: Work with the other zombie exterminators in the lab to push back the undead.  To fight off the zombies we will give you a Raspberry Pi, touchscreen, Java, and some Oracle Clouds.

sessions.title: More Java Community Insider Secrets!
sessions.description: In this presentation you will learn all of the insider secrets on how to become a presence in the worldwide community of 9 million Java developers.

sessions.title: Create an App using MIT's App Inventor!
sessions.description: Learn to make your very own app about your favorite animals with little to no coding experience! View your app in real time on any Android device and become familiar with MIT's easy-to-use App Inventor.

sessions.title: Voice User Interface - Design & Development for Chatbots & IOT
sessions.description:
In this session, you will learn the best practices to design & develop for Voice based applications, specificially:

1. Design UX for Voice Driven Applications for iOT and mobile

2. Learning about 4 different sdk's for developing voice based ui.

sessions.title: The Post Javascript Apocalypse
sessions.description: This talk speculates about the next language after JavaScript, and what to do in the mean time about some of the new features in ES6. There will be an emphasis on simplicity and quality. The web is cluttered and full of errors.

sessions.title: Early Idea Evaluation Tools
sessions.description: How to evaluate idea and make business model out of it.

sessions.title: Lean Startup for Engineers
sessions.description: Discover your customer and find out what they will pay for!  We'll show you how in this session to define your customer and discover what their true problem is.

sessions.title: gRPC Crash Course: Simple Microservices in Java
sessions.description:
gRPC is a new high-performance, open source RPC framework built on top of Protocol Buffers and HTTP/2.

In this session, Ryan Michela gives you an introduction to gRPC and its capabilities will live coding a simple IRC style chat system using gRPC.

sessions.title: Securing Your Containers
sessions.description: In this session we will be covering security automation, and we will discuss security strategies that can be implemented for CAPS (Chef, Ansible, Puppet, Salt) and Docker and how you can implement encryption easily without causing bottlenecks.

sessions.title: AWS Lambda with Serverless Framework and Java
sessions.description: In this session, we will talk about Serverless Applications, and Create and deploy a java-maven based AWS Lambda API. We will also explore the command line interface to manage lambda, which is provided out of the box by serverless framework.

sessions.title: Dream Teams: Making Your Dream (Team) Come True
sessions.description: What differentiates high performance teams? What makes it a dream team? What’s our role–and what’s the role of our leaders–in crafting culture that supports emergence of dream teams? What can we each do–what must we do–to be part of a dream team?

sessions.title: Service Discovery in Container Orchestration Frameworks
sessions.description: Learn how service discovery works in different container orchestration frameworks.

sessions.title: Numbers
sessions.description: Computers are machines that manipulate numbers. That is literally all that they can do, and yet they are now facilitating and mediating virtually all human activity. This is the story of numbers: where they came from, how they work, and where they may be going. Every programmer should know this story.

sessions.title: Character Sets
sessions.description: This is the story of the representation of text as numbers. We will range from the earliest codes, Hollerith and Morse, to what will likely be the last character code, Unicode. The mysterious control codes of ASCII will be explained. Subtle decisions made in the last century had large unintended consequences. The irritating eternal dilemma "Tabs or Spaces?" will finally be resolved logically for the first time.

sessions.title: Introduction To The Lean Definition Process
sessions.description: The Lean Definition Process provides an approach to uncovering the tangible 360 degree view of the full product to be built by leveraging the various points of view across all the new product touch points.

sessions.title: There Is No Such Thing as a Microservice!
sessions.description: What is architecture, why it matters and what exactly is the microservice architecture?

sessions.title: Modern HTML5 UI for desktop and embedded apps
sessions.description: How to create a modern HTML5 user interface and integrate it into a compiled desktop or embedded application. The example is a C# .NET application with an Angular UI, but the architectural concepts can be applied to other languages and frameworks.

sessions.title: Android Architecture & Material components with Kotlin.
sessions.description: This talk will cover Android Architectural Components (Room, Lifecycle-aware components, ViewModels and LiveData).  After building a clear understanding of the components we will explain how they work together to form a robust reference architecture.

sessions.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
sessions.description: Programmer & best-selling author of Cracking the Coding Interview presents a technical talk on how coding interviews work and how to do well on them. This will be a deeply technical talk covering data structures and algorithms.

sessions.title: Hiring Coders with Whiteboard Interviews and Other Questions
sessions.description: Tech companies are infamous for their whiteboard interviews. Learn best practices for doing these at your company -- or even if you should. Engineer and best-selling author will discuss interview styles and what works.

sessions.title: Business Networking Pickup Lines for Developers
sessions.description: In this workshop everyone will learn professional networking engagement techniques. Stand up, make in-person cold connections, find *the* person in the room you need to talk to, and qualify a person for a potential business relationship.

sessions.title: Intro to Test Driven Development
sessions.description: A platform-agnostic intro to Test Driven Development (TDD)

sessions.title: Getting Deep into Machine Learning with TensorFlow
sessions.description: In this talk we discuss Deep Learning, the technique that powers many of the most powerful Artificial Intelligent products and applications. Such as self-driving cars, automatic image labeling in social networks, and robotic vision.

sessions.title: A Math-Free Introduction to Neural Networks
sessions.description: Have you ever tried learning about Neural Networks but are allergic to dense equations?  This is the talk for you!  Learn the concepts behind neural networks with nothing more complicated than addition and multiplication.

sessions.title: Creating an AWS Lambda Function with Kotlin
sessions.description: In this session, we will create a lambda service on AWS using  Kotlin. Along the way, we will learn what a makes Kotlin an excellent replacement for Java and how simple it is to construct an AWS Lambda function.

sessions.title: Lockdown: a SHOCKING security primer for web developers
sessions.description: Security is an increasingly important part of building modern web applications, but it often falls victim to pressures of deadlines. In this course, we'll get hands on,  from attacking/defending standpoints, and learn how to keep the baddies out.

sessions.title: Principles of Security
sessions.description: As our systems become more distributed and more connected, security has never been more important. The catalog of known exploits is vast. There are more vulnerabilities and pitfalls than any expert can understand. And yet, security is so important that it can not be left to experts.  Fortunately, all good practices flow from a small set of principles. These principles should be known by every programmer and every manager.

sessions.title: Automating AWS infrastructure with the AWS Cli
sessions.description: We will cover using the AWS Cli in day to day DevOps work and application deployments.

sessions.title: BlockChain: Learn to implement Blockchain
sessions.description: Build a BlockChain App from scratch. Learn the fundamentals of BlockChain technology.

sessions.title: iOS: The Best Parts
sessions.description: To set our understanding of native iOS development we dive into how to build real world apps.  We then introduce iOS development by reviewing the Apple resources: “A Swift (4.0) Tour” using Playgrounds and  “Start Developing iOS Apps (Swift)”.

sessions.title: Clean Code – The Art of Decoupling
sessions.description: We will dive into why decoupling is so crucial and what design patterns. We start by reviewing the basics of Inversion of Control (IOC) and Dependency Injection (DI) and will move into Micro Services reviewing different ways of achieving decoupling.

sessions.title: Clean Code - Best Practices
sessions.description: Writing clean code can significantly lower these costs. However, writing clean code also makes you more efficient during the initial development time and results in more stable code, seeing the code in a holistic way.

sessions.title: Accidentally Manager – A Survival Guide for First-Time Engineering Managers
sessions.description: This session is about your career perspective as an engineer, especially when the path may take an “unexpected” turn from technical lead to first-time engineering manager.

sessions.title: Your User Stories Are Too Big!
sessions.description:
A common problem for scrum teams is user stories that are too big. When a user story is too big, it is harder to understand, estimate, and complete successfully.
In this session, come get hands-on experience splitting stories with 4 proven methods.

sessions.title: Agile Appetizer
sessions.description: Lost the appetite for Agile approaches?  Never had the appetite?  Don't actually know what "Agile" is all about?  Perfect!  Here's a quick appetizer to get you to that point of going "Oh, yum!  More please!"

sessions.title: Forward-Thinking Continuous Integration and Delivery Pipeline
sessions.description: Building the technology powering the best consumer email inbox in the world is no easy task. When you start on such a journey, it is important to consider how to deliver such an experience to the users.

sessions.title: C++ Today: The Beast Is Back
sessions.description: After being the exciting new language of the 80s and 90s C++ lost its luster in the 2000, but has come roaring back. This talk explains why.

sessions.description: You know the basics of templates and you are ready for more. This talk will add a half dozen template-based techniques to your C++ development toolbox. You don’t have to be a wizard to learn or use these techniques—you’ll just look like you are.

sessions.title: Linear interpolations using SQL window functions
sessions.description: Join Ami Levin for some pure T-SQL coding challenges fun!  You'll take apart common programming challenges that are typically hard to solve using conventional means.

sessions.title: Where did I leave my (primary) Keys???
sessions.description:
Ever wondered why so many tables have ID fields used as primary keys?
Is it a 'design pattern', or an unfortunate misunderstanding that got rooted?
If you have never gave it a second thought - this session is for you...

sessions.title: Advancing your Career through technical leadership skills
sessions.description: Becoming a technical leader requires a sustained and intentional effort. In this talk, we will review some best practices to develop the skills needed to successfully lead technical projects.

sessions.title: Augmented Reality for the masses
sessions.description:
We will cover what is Augmented Reality (AR) and why it's considered the next big thing in tech by explore how to build an AR app on three different platforms.
1) iOS ARKit 2) Android  ARCore 3) Game engines Unity and Unreal.

sessions.title: iOS: The Best Parts
sessions.description: Reviewing native iOS development with the best architecture, design patterns, libraries, components, tools, tips, tricks and new features from WWDC 2018 to build a real world app with Swift 5.0!

sessions.title: C++ Web Servers and APIs
sessions.description: C++ is over 33 years old and is still one of the most performant languages in existence. Learn to create a web server and API using C++.

sessions.title: Learn Basics of Artificial Intelligence with TensorFlow
sessions.description:
Learn how to create your first Artificial Intelligence model.
We will use TensorFlow and Python to create this model.
See how you can use technology to solve your day to day problems with Artificial Intelligence.

sessions.title: IoT on the Edge
sessions.description: Come learn how to do your part in building a fully connected world where all the little things are connected, where data can flow freely around the globe, and where compute is a commodity that may just as well happen in your sock as in a datacenter.

sessions.title: Azure in the Enterprise - Governance & Organization
sessions.description: Best practices for Azure in the Enterprise including tips and tricks to control costs, etc. so your boss/CFO puts you on a pedestal

sessions.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
sessions.description: Programmer & best-selling author of Cracking the Coding Interview presents a technical talk on how coding interviews work and how to do well on them. This will be a deeply technical talk covering data structures and algorithms.

sessions.title: Interview Like Google (or not)-But Better!
sessions.description: Be a better interviewer: make candidates happier, raise the bar, create a consistent process, and avoid rejecting good candidates or hiring bad ones. We'll discuss multiple interview styles so you can interview like Google (or not)-but better!

sessions.title: Cracking the Product Manager Interview
sessions.description: Product managers are sometimes called the "CEO of a product." But what is a product manager really and how you do you land this role? How to crack the PM interview?

sessions.title: Software Development Process
sessions.description: We'll have a discussion on development, code review, and testing processes. Good ways to estimate time and know if your using your time effectively. What works, what doesn't. How to know when is or isn't working.

sessions.description: Managers have critical roles to play enabling agile adoption and agile success. While “self-organizing” does not mean no managers, the old manager roles and rules no longer apply. This session is about manager roles that make agile teams thrive.

sessions.title: Big Data - the Biggest Fad of the Decade
sessions.description:
"The Emperor has no cloths!"
Big Data has been around for a decade, and few dared challenge it. 
Join the journey, where we will examine and peel layer by layer of Big Data, and expose it for what it is. 
A thought provoking session guaranteed!

sessions.title: Java developer’s journey in Kubernetes land
sessions.description: This code-only session will explain how a Java application consisting of different microservices can be deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.

sessions.title: Order a Burger with Spring Boot and Vue.js
sessions.description: See how to architect a burger-ordering app with Vue.js on the front-end, talking to a Java Spring Boot service on the back-end.

sessions.title: Disaster Recovery - What, Why, and How
sessions.description: In this talk I'll cover the what, why, and how of Disaster Recovery.

sessions.title: MongoDB First Steps
sessions.description: MongoDB is a document oriented database that has developers loving developing again. What makes this database unique? How do you work with it? Is it for you? Answers to all that and more in this session!

sessions.title: Productive React/TypeScript/TDD: Love Story from Hell
sessions.description: React, TypeScript, TDD: Individually popular, sparse in combination. In this session we write a React application in TypeScript, using TDD, putting the power of the IDE to work.

sessions.title: Developing Asynchronous, Message-Driven Microservices
sessions.description: Learn about the key role that messages and events play in a microservice architecture

sessions.title: Microservices: Decomposing Applications for Testability and Deployability
sessions.description: Learn how the microservice architecture accelerates the delivery of large, complex applications by improving testability and deployability

sessions.title: Dissecting Dynamo: Highly available key value store
sessions.description: Fundamentals behind designing highly available key-value stores such as Dynamo, Cassandra

In this light-hearted romp thru the world's most misunderstood programming language, Crockford reveals what is actually going on, and how we can use this to write better programs.

sessions.title: Q&A With Douglas Crockford
sessions.description: If you've never been to a Q&A session with Douglas Crockford, you are in for a treat. Ask anything you want, then be prepared for the answer. This is the follow on session to Douglas Crockford's first session where he talks about How JavaScript Works (his new book).

sessions.title: Introduction to Chatbots
sessions.description: This session will introduce the anatomy of a dialog and then we will build a chatbot together and deploy to slack and other social media channels using IBM Watson Assistant, IBM Functions and IBM Cloud.

sessions.title: Machine learning using the Keras Python library
sessions.description: This session will explore how the Keras Python library can simplify many methods in machine learning.

sessions.title: Testing in Production
sessions.description: Pre-production testing alone is not enough to ensure that your software is working in the only place that really matters: production. We'll cover production deployment and testing strategies, observability, and chaos engineering.

sessions.title: Human Learning: How We Learn & Why it Matters
sessions.description: Understanding how humans learn helps us inform, teach, and communicate better. Find out how to apply research to create better docs, videos, and presentations.

sessions.title: Common C++ Optimizations
sessions.description: The C++ standard gives compilers room to optimize the code we write and in this session, we’ll explore how we can write code that exploits this power.

sessions.title: Ask the Expert: Q&A with Engineering Managers
sessions.description:
How do I handle an unreasonable boss? What if I don't trust my team to deliver good code?  
In this unscripted format, speakers from the Management and Agile tracks answer your questions about challenges leading programmers.

sessions.title: Which Agile Framework Will Increase the ROI of My Company?
sessions.description: We will explore several agile frameworks (such as Scrum, XP, Lean, FDD, etc.) and recommend which of these agile frameworks increases the ROI for specific types of Companies. We will look at different technologies including GitLab, OnBase, & JIRA.

sessions.title: CISO/Security Vendor Relationship Podcast - LIVE Recording!

sessions.title: MongoDB Aggregation like a Champ!
sessions.description: Got data in Mongo? Need to query or run a report? You don't need add-ons! You don't need Spark, or a data warehouse... All you need is MongoDB, and some aggregation framework know-how! This session will get you started don the right track.

sessions.title: Microservices and Serverless Speaker Panel – The Road Ahead
sessions.description: Join our panel of experienced cloud experts as they answer your questions on the advantages and pitfalls of microservcies and serverless functions, and also share their insights into what comes next.

sessions.title: Conversational Interface for Alexa and Magical Chatbots Facebook Messenger
sessions.description: This talk will show you best practices from taking an idea and designing a conversational interface to support it on Bot platforms such as Alexa, Google and Facebook Messenger

sessions.title: Web Panel with Douglas Crockford, Steve Souders and Mike North
sessions.description: Join this star filled panel, Douglas Crockford, Steve Souders and Mike North talk about the web. A better set of luminaries you will not find

sessions.title: Accelerating Android Development with Google Jetpack
sessions.description:
This session will cover how Google Jetpack will accelerate Android Development by providing comprehensive architectures and frameworks.

This session covers all areas of Android development using Jetpack.
Foundation, Architecture, Behavior & UI

sessions.title: Technical Coaching Toolbox
sessions.description: I has been traveling the world as a technical agile coach for over a decade and have developed a structured approach for creating lasting change for his teams. In this session I'll teach the six most powerful practices from this approach.

sessions.title: Refactoring to Async
sessions.description: In this C# demo, we will go through a step by step guide to turn normal code into asynchronous code.

sessions.title: C# Real World Best Practices
sessions.description: This talk covers the essential C# best practices you need: memory management, properties, error handling, and exception-safe code.

sessions.title: SciFi Comes Alive on Mobile
sessions.description: Could we say science fiction is paving the way for the future scientist? We start by looking at the link between imagination and reality by exploring how Med Apps, AR and AI went from science fiction to running on mobile.

sessions.title: iOS: The Best Parts
sessions.description: This session will cover native iOS development with the best architecture, design patterns, libraries, components, tools, tips, tricks and new features from WWDC 2019.

sessions.title: Using Kubernetes for Machine Learning Frameworks
sessions.description: This talk will explain why and how Kubernetes is well suited for Machine Learing, deploying your ML models in production and setting up visualization tools like TensorBoard for monitoring. Specifically it will show how to setup a variety of open source machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Apache MXNet and Pytorch on a Kubernetes cluster. The attendees will learn distributed training, massaging and inference phases of setting up a Machine Learning framework on Kubernetes.

sessions.title: What's It Take to Be a (Good!) Manager?
sessions.description: Managing programmers is hard! Becoming a successful manager requires a drastic change of focus.

sessions.title: Building Reliable and Resilient Services
sessions.description: Talk about architectural patterns to make your services and distributed systems more resilient and reliable

sessions.title: The History of JSON
sessions.description: Learn about JSON and it's history from the man many say invented it, though  Douglas says he just discovered it.

sessions.title: Intro to Test-Driven Development
sessions.description: A platform-agnostic intro to Test-Driven Development (TDD)

sessions.title: How to successfully Open Source a project
sessions.description: Both individuals and companies can benefit greatly from open sourcing projects. In this talk, Carsten Jacobsen, Open Source Developer Advocate at Uber, talks about how to successfully open source a project.

sessions.title: Engineering scalable CICD pipelines using Jenkins and Pipeline Libraries
sessions.description: I plan to discuss the fundamentals of CICD, Jenkins pipeline libraries, examples for easy customization/extensibility across hundreds of services. Best practices and learnings doing this across hundreds of services and multiple teams will be shared

sessions.title: Learn to use Artificial Intelligence for Personalization
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence for Personalization implementation

sessions.title: GDPR and Privacy Around the World
sessions.description: The process to manage privacy around the world impacts software development as well as business processes. This talk will provide a high-level overview of managing privacy in global products.

sessions.title: MongoDB Introduction
sessions.description: MongoDB doesn't use tables, rows, or fixed schema. How does it work? This session will show you! Cutting through the rumors, legends, and myths this gentle introduction explains what this database is, what it isn't, and why.

sessions.title: ACID Transactions with MongoDB
sessions.description: ACID transactions are not always necessary in a document-oriented database. But if you do need them, Mongo now supports them! I'll show you how ACID transactions work in Mongo, and what it implies for your data design.

sessions.title: Real-ish Time Predictive Analytics with Spark Structured Streaming
sessions.description: Understanding your data is key to actually being able to learn from the potentially massive amounts of data you are storing every single day. Learn how to learn from your data and build a streaming spark application.

sessions.title: MicroServices - Real World Application
sessions.description: This session will describe how Microservices is used in the real world.

sessions.title: Situational Decision Making in a VUCA world!
sessions.description: Know what to do when you don't know what to do!  Understand what works works where and why.

sessions.title: GraphQL with Scala
sessions.description: GraphQL promises to simplify client-server communication. Used correctly, it can provide a clean and performant way to communicate. This talk will explore what we learned from that adoption focusing on both server-side and client-side aspects.

sessions.title: Cubes, Hexagons and More: Understanding the Microservices Through Shapes
sessions.description: Learn microservice architecture essentials through visual metaphors.

sessions.title: Top three use cases for Serverless with Examples
sessions.description: You will learn what serverless is and the top three use cases for this technology including creating APIs, microservices and event driven programming. We will look at key concepts and example code.

sessions.title: Building Distributed Teams
sessions.description: Practical advice and considerations for how to identify, build, and grow a distributed team.  The talk will cover issues like considerations for identifying a location, recruiting and building a team, effective and efficient communication channels, and ensuring remote offices are set up for success.

sessions.title: Agile, DevOps, and Hardware
sessions.description: Can DevOps apply to IoT devices? Over the course of 9 years and 3 hardware platforms, we tried just that and increased our cadence by a factor of 20x. We learned a ton along the way with some unexpected wins, which I'd like to share in this talk.

sessions.title: Critical Agile Practices, Nuanced Techniques
sessions.description: Five techniques that can make our teamwork and our teams dramatically more effective. The nuances I almost never see teams doing (and that have made my teams much more effective) that I coach all my teams in.

sessions.title: Securing Kafka at Paypal with 500 Billion Messages a Day
sessions.description:
This session will talk about the Kafka security which includes: Kafka Authentication;
Kafka Authorization; Zookeeper Security; Kafka Quotas; Performance

sessions.title: Navigating the React Ecosystem
sessions.description: Let’s walk through the tools that surround React and learn which you should prioritize learning first.

sessions.title: The Web Got so Good You Can Build a Startup in 1 Day
sessions.description:
10 years ago, building for the web was pretty hard. 

Nowadays you can conceptualize and launch a product in 1 day. React for the webapp, a UI kit for design, Gatsby to make it fast, GraphQL for data, Serverless for the backend.

This is the future.

sessions.title: Evolution of Javascript Modules
sessions.description: JS modules evolution, bundling, and front end development

sessions.title: React Is Your Friend: A Gentle Intro to the React Library
sessions.description: Where React has been and where it's going, an in-depth look at the React library.

sessions.title: A Gentle Intro to Reactive Java Programming and Systems
sessions.description: As Java is an object-oriented language that inherently supports the imperative programming style, asynchronicity presents a challenge that can turn the code into nightmare.  Reactive programming and systems are new ways to handle the complexity.

sessions.title: Time Travails With Java, Scala and Apache Spark
sessions.description: After a quick refresher of Unix epoch-based time keeping, we will explore time and date processing functions in Spark SQL, and the particular problems associated with making time window-based aggregations work as expected. (Advanced)

sessions.title: Building the World's Largest Bluetooth Finding Network
sessions.description: Jossie Haines, Platform Engineering Director at Tile, will explain how we built a secure location finding network that supports getting 1.5 billion unique location updates per day.

sessions.title: Q&A Panel with Engineering Managers
sessions.description: How do I handle an unreasonable boss? What if I don't trust my team to deliver good code? How can I improve your team's attitude about agile? Why do I have so many bugs???

sessions.title: Big Data, Big Dupe: A Little Session about a Big Bunch of Nonsense
sessions.description:
Join me for this enlightening journey to realize what Big Data is really all about.
Others have said: “Though Provoking”, “An eye opener”, “Realizations galore”, “It makes so much sense now”, "Wow. the best session by far in this conference."

sessions.title: One key to rule them all! Destroying data consistency and query performance
sessions.description:
Have you ever stopped to wonder why almost every table has some ID field as its primary keys? 
Is it a 'design pattern', or an unfortunate misunderstanding that got rooted? 
The answer might surprise you...

sessions.title: You Can Count on Numbers
sessions.description:
This is an informal history of numbers, from bundled sticks near the 
Nile to the supercomputer in your pocket. The machines know only 
numbers, and the way they think about numbers influences the design of 
our programming languages, which influences the way we think about numbers.

sessions.title: Artificial Intelligence: Potentials and Challenges
sessions.description: This presentation offers deep look into the field of artificial intelligence, its potentials and challenges. This presentation will also demonstrate some AI and machine learning hand-on applications using the Python language.

sessions.title: The Science of Programmer Motivation
sessions.description: In this age of sky-high salaries, outrageous benefits, and ever-changing technology we would be wise to pause and ask, “What motivates programmers to work, grow, and stay?”

sessions.title: Agile Delivery of Large Scale Android Applications
sessions.description: Building the best consumer email inbox requires a smooth, fast and straight forward deployment strategy that is not only automated but is also easy to build, and can scale to millions of its users.

sessions.title: Accidentally Manager – A Survival Guide for First-Time Engineering Managers
sessions.description: This session is about your career perspective as an engineer, especially when the path may take an “unexpected” turn from technical lead to first-time engineering manager.

sessions.title: Clean Code – The Art of Decoupling
sessions.description: We will dive into why decoupling is so crucial and what design patterns. We start by reviewing the basics of Inversion of Control (IOC) and Dependency Injection (DI) and will move into Micro Services reviewing different ways of achieving decoupling.

sessions.title: Leading through Innovation
sessions.description: How can I lead innovation to create long term transformation/adoption from a people, process, and technology perspective? We will explore answers to these questions by examining several organizational change management (OCM) frameworks.

sessions.title: Improve Quality and Joy: Agile XP Dojos Work
sessions.description: Learn about a six-week Agile XP Dojo enabling teams to discover ways to improve quality, sustainability, and team happiness with the help of extreme programming.

sessions.title: Make Your Code More Testable with the Hexagonal Architecture
sessions.description: Making your code more testable can be easy if you have the right architecture. In this session, you'll learn how the Hexagonal Architecture (aka Ports & Adapters) can not only make it easier to adapt to a changing world, but help keep things testable

sessions.title: How Humans Learn and Why It Matters
sessions.description: Understanding how humans learn helps us inform, teach, and communicate better. Find out how to apply research to create better docs, videos, and presentations in this example-filled session.
